titlestmt.titleproper: Ford Foundation records, Peace and Social Justice, Human Rights and Governance, Office Files of Sara Rios
A Guide to the Ford Foundation records, Peace and Social Justice, Human Rights and Governance, Office Files of Sara Rios FA1443
titlestmt.author: Katie Martin

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-10-01 04:49:48 UTC.

did.unittitle: Ford Foundation records, Peace and Social Justice, Human Rights and Governance, Office Files of Sara Rios

physdesc.extent: 25 boxes (8 letter document boxes, 2 half letter document boxes, 15 legal document boxes)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection contains miscellaneous office files of Sara Rios, former Director of the Human Rights and Governance Unit within the Peace and Social Justice Division at the Ford Foundation. Her office files contain conference files, reports, press materials, correspondence, and publications. Many grant-related materials in the collection between 1997 and 2000 are the files of Alan Jenkins. Jenkins preceded Rios in her role as Program Officer in the Peace and Social Justice Program from 1997-2000. Some correspondence with grantees and potential grantees is also present after 2000, when Jenkins became Deputy Director of Human Rights and International Cooperation at the Ford Foundation and when he was appointed Director of the reorganized Human Rights Program in 2001.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Sara Rios served as Director of the Human Rights and Governance Unit at the Ford Foundation from 2005-2012. Previously, she was the Program Officer for Racial Justice and Minority Rights from 2002-2005.
Rios earned her Juris Doctor degree at the University of Toledo College of Law and was admitted to the Ohio Bar in 1986. From 1998-2002, she served as Director of Litigation at LatinoJustice PRLDEF.
Rios left the Ford Foundation in 2012 to become president of the Ruth Mott Foundation in Flint, Michigan. She passed away from ALS in 2015.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The Ford Foundation records, Peace and Social Justice, Human Rights and Governance, Office Files of Sara Rios was originally processed by Katie Martin in July 2018. When the collection was initially processed, it consisted of Accession 2018:038. In 2019 and 2020, more Rios accessions arrived at the RAC (2019:147, 2019:190, 2020:025) and these were incorporated into the collection in 2021 by Katie Martin.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Sara Rios' Office Files arrived at the RAC from the Ford Foundation in multiple accessions between 2018 and 2020 (Accessions 2018:038, 2019:147, 2019:190, 2020:025).

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged into one series: Program Officer Files. The collection is organized as received from the Ford Foundation.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Ford Foundation has title, copyright and literary rights in the collection, in so far as it holds them.

The Rockefeller Archive Center has authority to grant permission to cite and publish material from the collection. Permission to publish extensive excerpts, or material in its entirety, will be referred to the Ford Foundation.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Notebook - October 2002; correspondence (some in Spanish); Affirmative Action Affinity Group, Montevideo, Uruguay; Summary Outline of Brazilian Legal Issues Affecting Racial Discrimination, Shearman and Sterling (March 6, 2002); Memos; Discussion with Afro-Colombian Mayors (April 22, 2003); Overview of US Affirmative Action Programs and Litigation in the Higher Education Context, Robin A. Lenhardt; Afro-Descendants in Brazil and Uruguay; Affirmative Action Affinity Group; Medicine and the Racial Divide, Elizabeth Phimister; Program Officers' Memorandum Draft by Sara Rios; Disarming the Private Attorney General, Pamela Karlan; High School Graduation Rates in the US; Minority Rights Group newsletter
